Description: Green mudstone figure of a bull. The horns of the bull are now lost, but a spiral pattern of its hide is visible at the forehead and with thin incised lines around its ears and at the top of the head. The body is large and heavy with its musculature clearly delineated across its legs and back. The body is elongated and the limbs are strong and thick. There are chips to the eyes, snout and tail of the animal, and the lower legs are missing. The object is supported on a slim modern base.
Curator's comments: The sculpture may have been influenced by artistic renderings of bulls found outside of Egypt, including Greek bronze representations of bulls and two dimensional representations of Cretan bulls.
